thread.title: IU an 'unwitting participant' in Louisville scandal
thread.title_full: IU an 'unwitting participant' in Louisville scandal

author: Mike Miller, The Hoosier Scoop
title: IU an 'unwitting participant' in Louisville scandal
text:
Previous Next _DSC7219.JPG 
Head coaches Rick Pitino and Tom Crean meet at mid court after the Louisville Indiana NCAA men's basketball game part of the Jimmy V Classic at Madison Square Garden in New York, Tuesday, December 9, 2014. Chris Howell | Herald-Times Posted: Friday, October 2, 2015 8:32 pm IU an 'unwitting participant' in Louisville scandal Mike Miller, The Hoosier Scoop heraldtimesonline.com | 24 comments 
Indiana athletic director Fred Glass said his department was an “unwitting participant” in tipping off the University of Louisville about an upcoming book alleging the Cardinals’ involvement in a salacious scandal. 
The book, set to be released by Indianapolis Business Journal Book Publishing LLC, details how a Louisville men’s basketball staffer allegedly paid an escort service to have sex with recruits over a four-year period. In addressing the allegations Friday afternoon, U of L athletic director Tom Jurich said he learned of the book through an Indiana University associate athletic director who contacted Louisville seeking to help a prominent IU booster identify a Cardinals player in a photo.
